job_details.degree_required: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration, or a related field.

jd: From: Ankit, Tek Inspirations ankit.rajoriya@tekinspirations.com Reply to: ankit.rajoriya@tekinspirations.com Job Description - Job title: Oracle Project Manager - Cutover ActivitiesLocation: RemoteDurtion: 12+ monthsKey Responsibilities: Cutover planning: Develop and manage the detailed cutover plan, outlining activities, resources, and timelines required for the transition from legacy systems to Oracle ERP. Stakeholder coordination: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including IT, business units, and external vendors, to ensure alignment on cutover activities and readiness. Oversee post-cutover stabilization activities, ensuring any issues are addressed quickly and that end-users have the support they need. Documentation: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for all cutover activities, including step-by-step procedures, roles and responsibilities, and lessons learned. Continuous improvement: After cutover, conduct a post-mortem review and implement best practices for future deployments or upgrades. Required Qualifications: Education: Bachelor s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration, or a related field. Experience: o 5+ years of project management experience, including at least 3 years with Oracle ERP implementations. o Proven experience managing cutover activities for large-scale Oracle ERP projects. Technical Skills: o In-depth knowledge of Oracle ERP modules (Finance, Supply Chain, HR, etc.) and cutover processes. o Familiarity with data migration tools, techniques, and best practices. o Strong understanding of project management methodologies, such as PMP, Agile, or Prince2. Soft Skills: o Excellent organizational and time-management skills, with a keen attention to detail. o Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to manage multiple stakeholders effectively. o Problem-solving skills, with the ability to make quick decisions under pressure. (1.) To leverage design expertise to ensure that software and products exhibit user-friendliness, intuitiveness, and alignment with user expectations, contributing to the creation of seamless user experiences. (2.) To lead a team of designers, provide guidance, and ensuring the delivery of high-quality design solutions in alignment with the overall business goals. (3.) To present design concepts and play a crucial role in shaping the overall design vision and strategy. (4.) To stay abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies to drive innovation and excellence in design
